com.intel.icecp.module.storage.persistence.orientdb

Class StorageProviderFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.icecp.module.storage.persistence.orientdb.StorageProviderFacade
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LegacyStorageProvider, QueriesStorageProvider, StorageProvider, TaggedStorageProvider

    public class StorageProviderFacade
extends Object
implements StorageProvider
    Class which implements specific versions of the provider and proxies calls onto legacy/tagged provider

    Composite Storage provider for using OrientDb graph database. Currently, it supports both embedded in-memory database and local file persistence. The default graph engine type is in-memory. To configure the local file persistent type, use customized OrientDbConfiguration as input to the constructor StorageProviderFacade(OrientDbConfiguration) like the followings:

    OrientDbConfiguration orientDbConfiguration = new OrientDbConfiguration();
    orientDbConfiguration.setStorageType(OrientDbStorageType.EMBEDDED_GRAPH);
    StorageProviderFacade storageProvider = null;
    try {
    storageProvider = new StorageProviderFacade(orientDbConfiguration);
    ... Business logic here ...

    } catch (Exception e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
    } finally {
    // clean up the resources
    ((StorageProviderFacade) storageProvider).shutdown();
    }
    For more details on how to configure OrientDB for local file persistent path, please see OrientDbConfiguration.
    See Also:
    OrientDbConfiguration, LegacyStorageProvider, TaggedStorageProvider

      • related

        public Set<Tag> related(Tag... tags)
                 throws TaggingOperationException
        Specified by:
        related in interface TaggedStorageProvider
        Parameters:
        tags - the matching tags to use for finding the related tags; e.g. if a set of messages is tagged with channel "/a/b/c", calling related("/a/b/c") may return {"message", "active", "sid:1", "sid:2", "/a/b/c"}. Note that the parameters themselves should be part of the returned set.
        Returns:
        the set of tags that also are linked to the vertex set given by the tags parameter
        Throws:
        TaggingOperationException - if the operation fails
